intro: Eriocaulon truncatum var. malaccense, commonly known as the Malaccan flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of wetland ecosystems.
